article.title: 10 Things To Do In Ubud At Night
article.lead_paragraph: Ubud is the spiritual and cultural heart of Bali and the place to go for rejuvenation of the body, mind and spirit. After spending a wonderful day in this charming town, fringed by rivers and tropical jungle, it is time to explore Ubud by night. There are lots of things to see and do, you just need to know where to go. Here are 10 things to do in Ubud after sunset:
article.proposal:
10 best things to do in Ubud at night

Ubud is the spiritual and cultural heart of Bali and thé place to go for rejuvenation of the body, mind and mind. After spending a wonderful day in this charming town, fringed by rivers and tropical jungle, it is time to explore Ubud by night. There are lots of things to see and do, you just need to know where to go. Here’s you nightly Ubud guide:

1. Cultural evenings at Bar Luna
This river-edged jungle bar is an amazing hangout hub in the center of Ubud and a must-visit during one of your evenings in the cultural heart of Bali. Every night something interesting is going on here. Think literary evenings, live music (not your usual cover band) and movie nights showing documentaries and art movies. A great place to meet like-minded travelers and soul seekers! They also have happy hours, don’t miss out! Check out the Bar Luna website.

2. Watch the traditional dance at the Ubud Palace
Every evening at 7.30pm there is something magical happening at the Royal Ubud Palace. Get your tickets from the street sellers outside, practise your bargaining skills a bit and get ready to gaze at the enchanting traditional dances of Indonesia. A thrilling experience for young and old!

3. Wine tasting at Bridges Bali 
Bridges Bali is located by a lush river valley in Ubud. Below the up-scale restaurant, sits the Divine Wine & Cocktail Bar. A place to enjoy a good glass of wine, delicious canapes, great company and gorgeous river views. During the daily ‘divine’ hour there will be no tax on your wine bills and every Friday, you can attend a wine tasting masterclass at 5.30pm for the price of 295.000 IDR. Visit their website for more information.

4. Caribbean vibes at Cafe Havana
For some hot, sweet Salsa dancing, you don’t have to travel the oceans of the sea, you can do it right here in Ubud Bali at Cafe Havana. The music will automatically get your body to move the right way, the cocktails are delicious and the ambiance is just perfect for dancing the night away as if you were in Cuba on the other side of planet earth.

5. Movie night at Paradiso
Paradiso is a raw vegan health food cafe and cinema found in the center of Ubud. Perhaps after munching a delicious vegan dinner, you can see what’s on in the cinema. Paradiso is the world's first organic, vegetarian and vegan Cinema, complete with an HD projector, a 25-meter screen, surround sound system and comfy lounge spots, seating up to a 150 people. Get your drinks and GMO-free popcorn and enjoy an evening of movie entertainment. Paradise also hosts workshops, live music festivals, family afternoons and more. Have a look at their website. A ticket to the movies costs Rp. 50.000 but you get to use it as a voucher on food. Great deal!

6. Night spa at the Dragonfly Sauna in Dragonfly Village
For an evening of cleansing, relaxation and rejuvenation visit the Dragonfly Herbal Steam Sauna in Ubud. For only Rp. 70.000 you get access to this heavenly place. The steam sauna uses natural herbs and every Wednesday, Thursday (silent), Saturday and Sunday, you can join the evening steam sauna around a Bonfire from 6pm to 9pm. There is a salt-water pool and the place is surrounded by rice paddies. It doesn’t get more idyllic than this!

7. Try the real local food at the Ubud night market
The Ubud market is a lively place where you can meet the locals and enjoy some delicious street food. Take your pick between many of the local food stalls. Try the martabak, chicken satay, babi guling, nasi goreng and fried banana as dessert. It’s all good and dirt cheap. The night market is located just outside of the center on Jalan Raya Tebongkang.

8. Climb mount Batur and see the sunrise of the island
To see the magical sunrise colouring the island in the morning, you will start this trekking at 2 am at night. This trekking will thrill the more adventurous and active travelers among us and you will need to be fit in order to finish this climb. The sunrise view is amazingly rewarding, creating a memory to stay with you for the rest of your life! 
9. Pay a nightly visit to the Bali zoo
Go an on a nightly safari at the Bali Zoo for a thrilling experience for the whole family.

10. Dine to the river view and a hundred sparkling lights at the Four Seasons cafe in Ubud
This amazing fine-dining venue, located by the riverside in Ubud, might be the most romantic spot to go for dinner. The natural surroundings, numerous sparkling lights, a starry night sky, soothing music and delicious food. Come and experience it for yourself. Check out the official website of the Four Seasons Riverside Cafe.

Now that you know where it's at, venture out and let us know about all of your experiences!
article.meta_description: Nightlife isn't just found in Kuta or Seminyak, you can have the best time in Ubud, Bali, with these handpicked activities and things to do once the sun sets.

snippets.title: 1. Watch traditional dance at Ubud Palace
snippets.title_with_numbering: 1. Watch traditional dance at Ubud Palace
snippets.description:
Every evening at 7.30pm, there is something magical happening at the Royal Ubud Palace, right in the center of town. You can get your tickets from the street vendor outside, practice your bargaining skills a little bit, and get ready to gaze at the enchanting traditional Balinese Legong Dance. The music, the colors, the movements - it is a thrilling experience for young and old and something you shouldn't miss out on during your stay in Ubud! 


> #### Ubud Palace
>
> **Address**:  Jl. Raya Ubud, Ubud, Gianyar, Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
>
> **Price**: from 80.000 IDR (6 USD)
>
> **Opening Hours**:  The show starts at 7.30pm

snippets.title: 7. Try real local food at the Ubud Night Market
snippets.title_with_numbering: 7. Try real local food at the Ubud Night Market
snippets.description:
The Ubud Night Market is a lively place where you can meet friendly locals and enjoy some delicious street food. Take your pick of an abundance of food stalls and munch all you can eat! Try the traditional nasi goreng, martabak, chicken satay or the Balinese specialty babi guling (suckling pig). For dessert, buy some pisang goreng (fried bananas) or the sweet martabak terang Bulan. It all tastes wonderfully good and the price is dirt cheap. The Night Market is located just outside the center on Jalan Raya Tebongkang. Go explore and remember, the authentic local food, available at markets like this, might be the thing you miss the most once you are back home!

> #### Ubud Night Market
>
> **Address**:  Jl. Raya Tebongkang No.39, Singakerta, Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
>
> **Price**: from 13.000 IDR (9.75 USD)
>
> **Opening Hours**:  5pm - 2am.
>
> **Access**: 6 kilometers / 3.7 miles drive from Ubud center

If you want to make full use of Ubud's markets, why not join a cooking class so that you will learn about making the dishes instead of sampling the cooked food from the markets.

>#### Balinese Cooking Class with Lunch or Dinner in Ubud
>
>**Price**: From 30 USD
>
>**Duration**: 5 hours
>
>**Highlights**: Shop for ingredients at a local market and explore Kelabang Moding Village. 
>
>Get hands-on as you learn to make traditional Balinese dishes and master tips and techniques from an expert chef in a Bali home kitchen
>
> No experience necessary: suitable for all skill levels
>
> Includes hotel pick-up and round-trip transfers
>
>[Viator](https://www.viator.com/tours/Ubud/Balinese-Cooking-Class-with-Lunch-or-Dinner-in-Ubud/d5467-33768P1)

snippets.title: 8. Climb Mount Batur and see the sunrise over the island
snippets.title_with_numbering: 8. Climb Mount Batur and see the sunrise over the island
snippets.description:
To see the magical sunrise of Bali, gently coloring the island in the at the early break of dawn, you will need to start the Batur Sunrise Trek at 2am. This trek will thrill the adventure seekers and active travelers among us. The view on top of Mount Batur is jaw-dropping! It takes some effort to get out of bed at this early hour and the trekking is not easy but it is truly rewarding and will be memorable for the rest of your life! 

> #### Mount Batur Sunrise Trekking
>
> **Price**: from 200.000 IDR (15 USD) including pick-up and drop-off to your hotel.
>
> **Duration**:  around 6 hours required.

Don't mind paying more to skip the crowds and enjoy the sunrise peacefully? Check out this private path on offer.

>#### Mount Batur Sunrise Trekking with Breakfast Atop
>
>**Price**: From 55 USD
>
>[Getyourguide](https://www.getyourguide.com/bali-l347/ubud-mount-batur-sunrise-hike-t97437)
